title: Christmas party invitation font
content:
Hello,

I have been trying to identify the black font on this invitation for the last 2 hours, using various apps and font identification sites, but with no luck. I figured I should ask some experts! The most unique letters are definitely the lower case "s" and "g", which extend below the other letters and overlap when next to each other.

I would greatly appreciate any help anyone can give me.

Thank you!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317182913im_/http:/typophile.com/files/DSCN6566-1-1024x767_5820.jpg)

Font: 

 Riesling 

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317182913/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")
author: christina.m.roth

comments.content:
Reisling:  
 [http://www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/riesling](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317182913/http:/www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/riesling "http://www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/riesling")

You probably already know that the script face is Scriptina:  
 [http://www.dafont.com/scriptina.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317182913/http:/www.dafont.com/scriptina.font "http://www.dafont.com/scriptina.font")
